page.title: 16OLD VILLAGE SOCIAL SURVEY
page.content: There had been little{movement }into the village during the past year,most people having live there for one to five years.People moving into the village had come from either local villages or from over 50 miles away. No single{householders}were interviewed.The majority had two or three children,mainly in the under 11 age group,and usually attended school locally.Two thirds had a wage earner,usually being{employed within 5 miles.The other third were retired. Hobbies were popular and varied. The majority of households had pets,usually a cat or a dog.Most people stayed locally fortheir {recreation but shopped out of the village.Almost a third of the people interviewed used public {transport.People generally seemed {satisfied with village life.
